Case reference: 2020007310.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1970, at approximately 3:00pm, John Brimskill was seen for the last time by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001016.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1983, the body of an unidentified man was found floating on the St-Lawrence river between L’ile Bouchard et St-Sulpice in Quebec. The man wore a partial upper denture and was missing three teeth.

Case reference: 2006002999.CaseDesc: The body of this adult male was located in a laneway behind 1556 Bloor Street West near Dundas Street in Toronto on March 21, 1997. He was thought to be a homeless person who frequented the area on a daily basis. Although he appears to be somewhat older, there are no arthritic changes to his bones, which are typical of older individuals. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150 lbs and his length was measured at 5'9", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Grey, White, Wavy, Medium length hair with a grey moustache and beard
Teeth: Poor dental hygiene with one restoration
Other: 750 ml bottle of Andres Golden Cream Canadian Sherry
Foreign Object: Right Ankle, plate and metal screws

Case reference: 2016070902.CaseDesc: On November 9, 2016, Campbell Hunter was last seen in Thompson, Manitoba. Mr. Hunter is known to lead an outdoor lifestyle and it is unusual for him not to contact his family.

Case reference: 2014003620.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1980, Arthur Keefe was travelling with a friend on snowmobile when the pair went through the ice and into the water. His friend managed to climb out, but Mr. Keefe went under and it is not known whether he resurfaced.

Case reference: 2014004591.CaseDesc: Philip Leishman left his family home in Kakisa Lake, Northwest Territories, with a friend in July of 2004. He advised his family that he was traveling to Fort McMurray, Alberta. It has been confirmed that Mr. Leishman was in Fort McMurray until late August of 2004. He has not been heard from since. He also has ties to Port Alberni, B.C., Grand Prairie and Calgary, AB.

Case reference: 2020016024.CaseDesc: In July of 2019, Anita Grace Wechsler was seen and heard from for the last time in Calgary, Alberta. During the time of Anita’s disappearance, she may have been despondent and involved in a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2019068654.CaseDesc: On November 16, 2019, Lara Parkin was seen for the last time in the South-West District of Montreal, Quebec. Lara is known to frequent Montreal’s downtown area and parks. She is also known to travel by foot or by public transit. During the time of her disappearance, Lara left her apartment without bringing any of her belongings.

Case reference: 2018070318.CaseDesc: In the summer of 1983, Angela Hartmann left home to travel to Ottawa, Thunder Bay, and Calgary before attending fall classes at Trent University in Peterborough, Ontario. It is believed that Angela's last known location was in August of 1983 in Ottawa, Ontario at the Ottawa Youth Hostel.

Case reference: 2014005265.CaseDesc: At approximately 4:00 p.m. on Saturday June 13, 2009, Devon Brock Moldowan left his apartment in Jasper and did not return. He has not been in contact with family or friends since. Mr. Moldowan does not have a vehicle or bike and is believed to have left on foot.

Pants: Black, Patches with yellow and orange stitching
Tattoo: Chest, The words "I'll keep you here for all my"

Case reference: 2010000198.CaseDesc: Tim Mason was known to be an avid walker, frequenting trails and off-road areas. He left his house on foot during the morning and never returned. Mr. Mason suffered from heart problems.

Hair: Black, Grey, Short, Salt and Pepper

Case reference: 2016062636.CaseDesc:
On November 6, 2016, Maxwell Harvey Mayling was reported missing from Prince George, British Columbia.  Mr. Mayling was last heard from in early October, 2016 by friends and family.  Mr. Mayling is known to frequent both the Prince George and Fort St John municipalities, and was last known to have been in Prince George since July 2016.

Mr. Mayling's maroon 1995 Ford Taurus was located in late November, 2016 in Prince George, however all other efforts to locate Mr. Mayling have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2017021464.CaseDesc: Since April 14, 2017, Deborah Anne Hutchinson's family has not seen or heard from her. Deborah's vehicle was later located in the Cossitt Heights area.

Case reference: 2014003711.CaseDesc: Between May 25 and June 2, 1978, Gerry Maurice Gascon received the services of the Algoma Hospital in the City of Greater Sudbury. He has not been in contact with anyone since his release from Algoma Hospital.  Gerry usually wears blue jeans, a black leather jacket and cowboy boots.

Case reference: 2020007351.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1981, at approximately 3:00pm, Maria Cowan was last seen as she left her home with a friend to go shopping in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Leather, Brown, Fur on collar and sleeves

Case reference: 2006021399.CaseDesc: On June 28, 2000, Charles Siljander was last seen at the Marina Park in Thunder Bay, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance reports state that Charles appeared to be confused, forgetful, and that he had lost a significant amount of weight. On September 15, 2000, Charles’ abandoned vehicle, a grey 1981 Chevy pickup truck, was located on a logging road south of Thunder Bay, and near the Canadian and American border.

Case reference: 2014005202.CaseDesc: On November 10, 2008, Ani Ashekian phoned her family residing in Canada while visiting Hong Kong, China. Ani a world traveler has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2017040791.CaseDesc: On the night of July 16, 2017, Thomas Burke was seen for the last time leaving his home in Liverpool, Nova Scotia. Thomas had left after a family meeting over financial issues. It did not appear that he took anything with him.

Case reference: 2014005358.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2007, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Ana Jimenez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Ana’s daughter found that her mother and all of her personal belongings were gone. Ana had been visiting from Columbia and was due to return on September 27, but never boarded her flight.

Case reference: 2014003382.CaseDesc: On May 27, 1988, Mr. Umpherville and a friend were driving to The Pas where they stayed the night. In the morning the two departed The Pas via 20 foot yawl with the intent on going to Easterville. They departed the Umpherville settlement around 1300hrs and they briefly stopped at Pine Bluff around 1600 hrs. It is believed they then stopped at a friends trappers cabin at Rat Hunting and ate a meal. The last thing the survivor remembers, is seeing the lights of Easterville and he crawled to the front of the boat where he fell asleep. He awoke around 0500 hrs the next day and Mr. Umpherville was no longer in the boat and he was adrift. Numerous islands in the area were searched, shorelines were searched and several air and water patrols were made without success. Mr. Umpherville has not been located and his whereabouts is unknown.

Hat: Grey, baseball style with "Hi Ho Hi Ho" on front

Case reference: 2021037680.CaseDesc: Augustine Moloi went missing from Calgary, Alberta, in October 2008. Augustine's family has not seen or heard from him since this time.

Case reference: 2006013899.CaseDesc: Robert Heintz went missing from Kearns, Ontario on the morning of December 1, 1982.  Mr. Heintz went into the bush behind Larder Lake Public School with some friends and became separated from them.  He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2019013046.CaseDesc: In August 2018, Celia Maria Da Silva was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004060.CaseDesc: On December 31, 1973, Conor Sheehan was seen for the last time when he left his family residence in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014000022.CaseDesc: Cynthia Albena Audy was last seen getting into a vehicle in the North End area of Winnipeg, Manitoba on October 28th, 2004.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Heart and cross

Case reference: 2012020054.CaseDesc: Glenn Colombe was last seen by his parents on June 28, 1989. At this time, he indicated to his parents he had a sore head which he said was the result of a fight he had been in earlier in the evening. He has not been seen since.

Hat: Cotton, White, philly flyers ball cap

Case reference: 2007000199.CaseDesc: Eric Ram was last seen at 9:00 a.m., on October 5, 1991.  He left his residence to go to the local store to buy milk and a paper and never returned.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Thick brown beard, moustache
Scar: Left Forearm, From wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2013000126.CaseDesc: In December 2007, Bonnie Marie Joseph was reported missing to the Fort St-James RCMP.  Further investigation determined that Miss Joseph was last seen on September 8, 2007 in Vanderhoof, BC.  She led a high risk lifestyle and was known to hitchhike alone between Fort St-James, Vanderhoof and Prince George, BC.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, heart with Mom & Djily

Case reference: 2017056566.CaseDesc: Darryl Gundrum was last seen between March 1 and September 30, 1970, near Sherwood Park, Alberta.

Case reference: 2006012999.CaseDesc: Joshua Kennet was last seen in the water after the boat he was riding in overturned on Grayson Lake, Ontario on October 13, 1995. Joshua is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014004732.CaseDesc: Waylon Edwin Smith was last seen in the Lake St. Martin area of Manitoba.  He had lived in Winnipeg and gone to Lake St. Martin to visit family.  He went for a walk and never returned.  He suffered from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2018023712.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2018, Elsa Vargas was last seen near her home in Chateauguay, Quebec. Ms. Vargas also has citizenship in Costa Rica.

Mark: Right Cheek, Mole on the right side

Case reference: 2020011480.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1988, Amerk Barbarian was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Amerk had been seen by his landlord for the last time when his rent was collected.

Case reference: 2014004917.CaseDesc: Robert Rudish and Lee Vrba arrived in Island Lake Manitoba on June 11, 1972, to fish. On June 17, RCMP received a report that a canoe was found overturned in the water. The canoe was soon identified as belonging to Mr. Vrba. RCMP Investigators surmised the men went missing on either the Thursday or the Friday. The weather on both days was extreme, with high winds gusting to 30 mph, which caused the lake to be quite rough. Neither of the two men have been located and it is presumed both drowned.

Tattoo: tattoo on right or left forearm

Case reference: 2006019699.CaseDesc:
Pierre Couture was last seen in Cowansville, Quebec. He may have been hiding from
authorities and has not been seen since that time.

Case reference: 2014001521.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1972, a helicopter carrying a pilot and three passengers went missing in Lake Winnipeg. The helicopter left Thompson, Manitoba at 3:20 p.m. and was heading for Winnipeg after stopping at a number of communities. The helicopter landed at Warren's Landing at approximately 5:20 p.m., and left for Winnipeg. The pilot reported that the weather was poor and he estimated his arrival in Winnipeg at 8:00 p.m. At 5:50 p.m. there was radio contact with the pilot where he stated that he was over Poplar River. This was the last radio contact with this helicopter. The Canadian Air Search and Rescue, private aircraft and police aircraft searched until November 17, 1972 when the search was suspended until the spring of 1973. Nathan Kryger and Ian Fraser are presumed dead as a result of the helicopter crash. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2006027099.CaseDesc: Mr. Deorksen and two acquaintances were travelling on Kioshkokwi lake, Pentland Township, Kiosk, Ontario, in a canoe when it capsized. The two acquaintances were located deceased, but Mr. Deorksen has never been found and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014002651.CaseDesc: Mabel Leo was last seen leaving a party near Nairn Falls, Pemberton, BC, in 1969, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014006026.CaseDesc: Gilles Valcourt was last seen at the Canada Hotel in Waterloo, Quebec on December 29, 1974. His family has had no news since.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, A dagger and a cross

Case reference: 2020024219.CaseDesc: On the night of July 6, 2020, Richard Kocik left his residence in Wasaga Beach, Ontario on foot. Richard left his wallet and personal identification behind. Richard has a history of walking away from his residence due to mental health issues similar to dementia. He has always been located after a few days. There was an extensive search conducted to locate Richard which yielded negative results.

Hair: Black, Grey, Salt and pepper hair colour
Tattoo: Left Chest, Heart shaped thumb print
Left Forearm, Footprint with the name "Ryan"

Case reference: 2016068490.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1971, Mr. Georges Turcotte went missing from the Saint-Hyacinthe, Quebec area. Georges was last seen at his home with his wife.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Snake or zig zag

Case reference: 2014004457.CaseDesc: Stephon Payne was last seen at his residence on October 6, 2002. On the same day, Stephon was seen in the area of 106 Avenue and 84 Street, Edmonton, Alberta. Stephon may have also been in the area of the Dawson Bridge in Edmonton. A jacket believed to be Stephon’s was found at the bridge.

Case reference: 2014003835.CaseDesc: Janice Howe left her family home in the Fort Garry area driving her father's 1985 Oldsmobile Cierra, and has not been seen since. Ms. Howe's vehicle was located the following morning 19 km east of Kenora, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003002.CaseDesc: Roger Paul Bertrand left his residence on November 11, 1999, between the hours of 10:00 and 11:30 am. He appeared nervous a week prior to his disappearance due to an upcoming commitment. He was on a disability pension and suffered from back and leg problems which required a brace and a cane to walk.  He left behind his brace and cane at his residence. It appears that Mr. Bertrand may have been a victim of foul play.

Jacket: Leather, Black, With buckles and zippers
Tattoo: Left Hand, Raccoon between the thumb and finger.

Case reference: 2015049567.CaseDesc: Raymond Chalifoux was last seen on May 25th, 2015 at the Fort St John Hospital. Mr. Chalifoux received abdominal surgery and left the hospital against the advice of medical staff. He left in an unknown direction. Extensive searches were conducted with negative results. Mr. Chalifoux has not been seen or heard from since.

Vest: Black, Black vest with designs on chest

Case reference: 2014003446.CaseDesc: Dawn Crey was a resident of the downtown east side of Vancouver; she was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. She was reported missing on December 11, 2000 after failing to attend a medical appointment. Foul play is suspected in Ms. Crey's disappearance.

Case reference: 2014006276.CaseDesc: On September 25, 2013, Mohamed Ali Qazi was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. At the time of his disappearance, Mohamed was in a Chevrolet Malibu rental vehicle that was later located in a shopping center in the city of Terrebonne, Quebec. His friend, Pierre Daniel, was also reported missing. The two men were often together.

Case reference: 2014005273.CaseDesc: Elaine Frieda Alook was last seen on May 11, 2004, on Tower road, outside of Fort McMurray, Alberta.

Scar: Lower Back, She had a cast from her wrist to elbow on her left arm

Case reference: 2008005898.CaseDesc: Paul Tenke left his family home on his mountain bike.  He had been under psychiatric care and had medication with him.  He was reported missing by his father.

Scar: Head, on face from recent accident

Case reference: 2014005295.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2007, at approximately 10:30 p.m., Javed Hoosain was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Javed had a dispute with his mother prior to leaving his residence.

Case reference: 2014006547.CaseDesc: Gregory Caesar was last seen near Watson Lake, Yukon Territory, in October, 2009. He was hitchhiking along the Alaska Highway and was believed to be heading to the Lower Mainland area of British Columbia.

Case reference: 2004005470.CaseDesc: Tamra Jewel Keepness disappeared from her home on Ottawa Street in Regina, Saskatchewan when she was just 5 years old. She went missing from her bedroom sometime overnight.

Pants: Denim, Blue, Pockets on the front

Case reference: 2014001801.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1992, Marshall Holmes wandered into the bush near Vassar, Manitoba and has not been seen since. Mr. Holmes was 73 years old at the time and was described as a recluse and a hermit. Mr. Holmes had gone missing in the past and had returned on his own accord. He enjoyed being in the bush and liked to sleep in the long grass. The last time he went missing he was gone for 3 days and came out of the bush when he became hungry. Extensive searches were done by land, air and with the assistance of a police dog. Marshall Holmes has never been located.

Jacket: Nylon, Blue, White, Has 3 vertical stripes

Case reference: 2006022099.CaseDesc: Duane Wicklund and Edward Kotula were last seen on October 7, 1967, in a loaded boat on Sturgeon Lake. They were vacationing in the area and heading to Margaret Resort on Harris Bay. Neither has been seen since and both are presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Nose, from nose to upper lip

Case reference: 2014004907.CaseDesc: On March 7, 2006, at approximately 7:30 p.m., Quan Li, an international student, was seen for the last time by her landlord in Toronto, Ontario. Quan had advised that she would be away for a few days.

Case reference: 2014003070.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1996, Yolande Trudeau Laberge was seen for the last time near the Larocque Bridge in Salaberry-de-Valleyfield, Quebec. Yolande has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Right Arm, Under arm, approximately 1 inch

Case reference: 2013000142.CaseDesc: Richard Dryland was known to be homeless in the Grande Prairie, Alberta area. Mr. Dryland lived a transient lifestyle and often travelled to BC. In November 1993, he was released from the Peace River Correctional Centre. His family has not heard from him since.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Heart and dagger

Case reference: 2021053487.CaseDesc: On August 4, 1988, the partial remains of an unidentified man were discovered on Trespassy beach in Newfoundland and Labrador. The man may have been of Caucasian ancestry.

Case reference: 2017047335.CaseDesc: On July 30, 2017, skeletal remains were found at the Montreal River Harbor located on Lake Superior. The location is approximately one hour north of Sault Ste. Marie on Highway 17. The Ontario Forensic Pathology Service has been able to determine that the remains are that of a male age 50-100 years old. Found on him was Canadian currency dated 2016, therefore it is believed he may have been there as early as the Spring of 2016. It is unknown how the male travelled to this area, but it is believed that he may have taken a bus, walked or hitchhiked.  He was carrying a back pack with camping supplies along with a firearm that would have been concealed in a cardboard box. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2015036270.CaseDesc: Brian Franko was last seen on July 10, 2015, walking away from the Saskatchewan Hospital.  He did not appear to be in a good frame of mind.  Brian was walking toward the South Saskatchewan River when he was last seen.  Extensive searches were conducted, with no success.

Case reference: 2014005846.CaseDesc: André Boucher was last seen on July 16, 2012 in Montreal. Mr. Boucher was living in a rooming house and left all his belongings behind. Mr. Boucher was also known as "Popeye"

Case reference: 2014002505.CaseDesc: On January 27, 1988, Lisa Somerton was seen for the last time outside of her residence located at 1220 Merivale Road in Ottawa, Ontario. She was observed approaching a black sports car with two people inside.

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2012020648.CaseDesc: Andrew Wiebe went missing from his residence in Saskatoon, SK on January 11, 1988. The vehicle he was driving at the time of his disappearance was later located abandoned in the Anglin Lake District, SK.

Case reference: 2014002728.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1996, at approximately 2:00 p.m., Gary Landry was last seen as he left his residence in Thunder Bay, Ontario, on his dark blue 12 speed Supercycle Mountain bike with black plastic fenders. Gary was prone to having seizures and frequented the north side of Thunder Bay on his bicycle.

Case reference: 2013000026.CaseDesc: John Antic's wife spoke with him at 11:00 a.m. on November 5, 2012 at a local Burlington mall. Mr. Antic left the mall wearing appropriate clothing for the weather. At approximately 7:30 p.m., Mrs. Antic received a phone call from a woman on behalf of Mr. Antic. She could hear her husband in the background saying he was eating dinner at a restaurant in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Mr. Antic's presence at the restaurant was confirmed. It is believed that he was on foot, and is familiar with public transportation. Mr. Antic has had no contact with his family or banking institutions since. There were no pre-existing medical, domestic or mental health issues.

Hair: Grey, Short, Short hair on sides and balding across top
Hat: Black, A black flat topped hat with a brim at front.  No markings.

Case reference: 2012020167.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from Burrard Inlet. He was previously discovered as a stowaway on the vessel S.K. Junior that originated in Nigbo, China on March 15th, 1997 and arrived in Vancouver April 4th, 1997.

Teeth: Stained, Poor oral hygiene and forensic analysis identified many unique characteristics in his dentition.
Jacket: Synthetic, Blue, Red, blue and white track suit jacket with stripes down the sleeves

Case reference: 2014001233.CaseDesc: On September 15, 2013, the remains of an Asian or mixed race male were discovered in Kananaskis County near Highway 40. The individual may have had episodes of malnutrition or anemia.

Case reference: 2014001015.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1975, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 25 to 30 years old, was found in the County of Wellington on the grounds of a private club called "Clearwater Enterprises Ltd.". His post-mortem length was measured at 5’8”-5’10”, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was a heavy smoker. He was estimated to have been there since August-late September the previous year.

Other: Single blade pocket knife with inscription "Niagara Falls"

Case reference: 2016061152.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1990, a male was found in the Detroit River, in LaSalle. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is believed to have been dead for approximately two months.

Socks: White, blue and red horizontal rings at top
Suit: Wool, Maroon, two-piece jogging suit with no pockets

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2013000108.CaseDesc: Roger Houle is missing from Montreal since July 12, 1996. Roger is hearing impaired and mute. He left his home without taking anything. He worked for 15 years at the same place and he never advised his employer that he would not be returning to work.

Case reference: 2006013999.CaseDesc: Walter Glynn was last seen July 23, 1980 walking southbound on Main Street, Kirkland Lake.  Mr. Glynn was heading to the A&P grocery store at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005227.CaseDesc: Carl Chenier was last seen in Montreal on February 23, 2009 by the superintendent of his apartment. It is believed that he may have mental health problems, but he was not on any medications. He often used the Montreal Metro.

Case reference: 2016055037.CaseDesc: Human remains were found on May 10, 2006 in a field near Mossleigh, AB. They are believed to be those of a female, over the age of 40, possibly of Caucasian or Aboriginal descent, who was between 5’2” and 5’6”. The individual was missing teeth and likely wore an upper denture. The individual may have complained of joint pain due to arthritis. The remains appear to have been there from 1 to 5 years

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Cheek, Healed fracture of right cheek bone
Mark: Right Side Of Head, Large button osteoma on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2006007699.CaseDesc: Kelvin Norris left his residence on November 27, 1984 at about 11:00 pm, he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020132.CaseDesc: François Robillard's family reported his disappearance on July 16, 2010. François' associate, Guy Verdon was also reported missing around the same time.

Case reference: 2001008160.CaseDesc: Jesokah was last seen at approximately 21:30 hours as she was going to take a bus back to the village of Sooke.

Case reference: 2020006473.CaseDesc: On April 22, 1967, at approximately 6:00pm, Roy Debone was last seen by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002584.CaseDesc: On October 1, 1989, Carlo Dentoni was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Carlo sold antiques and travelled regularly to Italy. He completed his post-secondary education at universities in Calgary and England.

Case reference: 2014001606.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1986, Sarah Pelletier was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. Witnesses saw her jump off the Jacques-Cartier Bridge into the Saint-Lawrence River at approximately 9:00 p.m.. Sarah hasn't been seen since.

Case reference: 2017056443.CaseDesc: Kristina Ward is a 20 years old aboriginal female who has been missing since September 27, 2017. Kristina is schizophrenic and is possibly using drugs. Kristina is developmentally delayed and is described as being vulnerable and easily trust people she does not know.  Kristina has money and a cellphone, however, neither have been used or accessed since September 27, 2017. Kristina was last seen in Surrey at the intersection of 104th Avenue and 144th St. with an unidentified male.

Mark: Upper Lip, Birthmark on upper left lip

Case reference: 2012020006.CaseDesc: Lucas James Degerness was last seen on June 7, 2007 in Prince George, British-Columbia. He spent that night with a friend.

Mark: Torso (Back), Brown in color, left side
Head, Dime size bald spot - front

Case reference: 2013000102.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1981 at approximately 7:30 p.m., Lawrence (Larry) Bennett left Princess Harbour, Manitoba in his boat heading for Matheson Island. He left with his sheepdog, and the trip should have taken 20-25 minutes. When he left he was traveling straight into the wind, and the water was reported as being rough. Mr. Bennett never arrived at Matheson Island. Mr. Bennett is presumed to have drowned, his remains have never been recovered.

Case reference: 2016065657.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1982, this male was recovered from Lake Erie near Port Colborne. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160-170 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is not known how long he had been in the water.

Teeth: Missing third molars; he has some silver fillings and 2 crowns
Shirt: Black, Dark Blue, t-shirt; inscription on the front of the shirt read "SAVE ELECTRICITY..DO IT IN THE DARK"
Socks: Tan, White, rust colored trim on the cuff
Boots: Tan, wearing a single work boot, approximately size 10

Case reference: 2005003399.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2004, an unidentified man was recovered from the Whirlpool in the Lower Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 200 lbs. and his length was measured at 6'0", however these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. This male is uncircumcised, and his appendix is present. It is believed that this individual had been in the water for less than 3 weeks but it is also possible that the body could have been in the water over the winter.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Few strands a couple of inches long
Teeth: Natural teeth with extensive dental restorations

Case reference: 2014001255.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1979, Robert Caldicott last spoke with his father on the telephone. Mr. Caldicott failed to attend several appointments in the following days.

Case reference: 2014007308.CaseDesc: On April 23, 1970, the body of a two to four week old male baby was found on the ice under the bridge on Highway 4, south of Kyle, SK. Investigation failed to identify the infant or suspects. This case is being investigated by the Office of the Chief Coroner and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

Case reference: 2014004671.CaseDesc: Murphy Quill was last seen in mid-July 2005. His family and friends are concerned for his well being as it is unusual for him to be out of contact for this length of time. Although he does not have a fixed address, Mr. Quill is known to frequent the Main Street strip and the area near 75 Martha Street in Winnipeg, MB.

Case reference: 2016068328.CaseDesc: This male foot was found washed up on the shore of Gull Island in Presqu'ile Provincial Park. The foot was inside a black "PUMA" ankle sock and a size 11 women's "Mizuno Wave Prophecy" running shoe. The shoe was first available for sale in Spring 2011. The post-mortem interval is anywhere from one month to 2 and a half years.

Case reference: 2014004566.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1981, at approximately 5:00pm, Dennis Krioul was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Dennis’ wife states that he was in some business trouble and he had a warrant out for his arrest for fraud.

Case reference: 2021059908.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2016, the partial remains of an unidentified man were recovered in Renews, Newfoundland. Between 2016 and 2018, additional remains belonging to this man were recovered.

Case reference: 2017027475.CaseDesc: On May 14, 2017, Roman Mussabekov was seen for the last time when he boarded a flight at the Montreal-Pierre-Elliott-Trudeau International Airport in Montreal, Quebec. He checked-in at a hotel on the island of Antigua in the Caribbean, but did not check-out. Roman contacted his mother a few days after his arrival to tell her that he was going on a hike in the mountains. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Short, Straight, Short on the sides, longer on top

Case reference: 2012030001.CaseDesc: In April 2011, both parents took their son, Aleksander to visit the mother's family in Poland. The father came back to Canada on his own on May 13, 2011. The mother, Elzbieta Nowacki and child did not return to Canada.

Case reference: 2006010299.CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.

Case reference: 2008015499.CaseDesc: Sheryl Sheppard was last seen on January 2 1998, on Lundy's Lane in Niagara Falls, Ontario. An extensive investigation by the Hamilton Police Service was conducted but Sheryl Sheppard has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2016061833.CaseDesc: On 11 April, 1982, a female was found floating in the Inner Harbour near the Royal Canadian Yacht Club. Her appendix was present. Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being 136 lbs and her length was measured at 5'1", however, these measurements may not represent her actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. She is estimated to have been in water from several weeks to months.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Shoulder, healed fracture of her clavicle
Scar: Right Abdomen, her gallbladder had been removed

Case reference: 2015011670.CaseDesc: On June 8, 1998, the body of a male was spotted by boaters on the St. Lawrence River, at St-Donat near Bellerive Park. According to the autopsy, the man may have made previous suicide attempts. He was found to be dressed in light clothing, suggesting his death may go back to the heat wave during the month of May 1998.

Socks: Grey, One sock on the right foot.
Bathing Suit: Nylon, Blue, Boxer type swim suit,  "Surf King Majestic" Brand, size XL
Scar: Abdomen, Vertical scar near the belly button.

Case reference: 2014002329.CaseDesc: Blair Henry Yensen left his residence in the town of Capreol on January 7th, 1992. He was last seen walking on Ski Hill Road. He has a noticeable limp, walks with a cane and has a shoe insert in his left shoe. He smokes very heavily. He suffers from severe depression, seems to be quite religious, and speaks in a religious manner.

Jacket: Fishing Jacket, blue with yellow and gold lettering on the front and back.
